phrase.item: Our houses are on a hill.
On one side is a stream, on the other side is the Neugal river, and by that river there is a creek.
The thing was that at that time we used to have a watermill on the edge of the Neugal river.
We connected a water channel from the nearby creek and used to serve by grinding peoples' grain.
She began to speak, "Dear heart, if you grind my grain it will be a great kindness. There is not even food at home today."
"Okay, bring the grain, I grind it.
To me, darkness will definitely happen, but where am I to go very far?
My houses are just a climb up the hill steps."
He became a little nervous, "What kind of grain is this?
(I) had seen feed of grains/seeds; but feed of sand, though, (I) even never saw.
but until where will (you) be saved? The day after tomorrow, though, you will definitely come to me."
